author: swanfinance
title: Earn Interest on CeFi and DeFi
description: A maioria dos usuários de criptografia utiliza intercâmbios centralizados, mas é preciso mais conhecimento e iniciativa para utilizar plataformas descentralizadas (apenas $91 bilhões).

f6_assessments.q0: While the idea is good in principle, careful inspection of the website and documentation reveals that all interests are paid out in SWAN. While it is normal for projects to bootstrap by distributing their own token, there is no mention of how the project will make use of Defi to actually generate revenue. SWAN tokens will eventually have to be swapped for money or other tokens.
f6_assessments.q1: The goals described by the proposal are achievable and the team looks competent. The technical implementation plan is laid out clearly, with the caveat that it is not explained HOW plutus will be used to generate revenue.
f6_assessments.q2: The main metric for this project is number of onboarded users, which is hard to transparently audit. Other good metrics would have been revenue generated for users (which would be verifiable if using on-chain transactions)

f6_assessments.q0: The problem that the proposer is trying to solve is not clearly described. I suggest to the proposer to better explain the problem so that the CA can rate its impact on the cardano network. Furthermore, I suggest to the proposer outline the value it would add to the ecosystem as well some key metrics and goals of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal lacks some basic information that will not favor its implementation. I suggest to the proposer to provide evidence of relevant skills and experience.This can be done by adding a linkedin profile of the team members or any other resources the proposer judges adequat for that. The proposer should also include a plan if additional funding is needed. Furthermore, a reasonable timetable to complete the work will also help to gain a positive rate on the feasibility.Infine, I think that a plan that explains clearly the product the proposer is trying to build, will help too. Altogether, this proposal needs to be improved in order to has some chances of getting implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Some critical information is missing in this proposal, making it difficult to audit. The proposer should add a comprehensible roadmap with reasonable milestones. This can help track the progress of the project. Furthermore Metris and strong KPIs should be added in order to measure the success of the proposal overtime. Infine, a clear description of the problem should be provided and a well explained solution as well.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge correctly as it aims to bring more users to use Cardano DeFi. The proposal anyways does not take in consideration the potential directions suggested in the challenge brief, suggesting an alternative road: using a CeFi platform as a way to lead new users to DeFi. This idea could lead them to stay into the CeFi world, as the effort to get an extra interest could not be worth the extra effort to switch to a DeFi environment. Plus, potentially this is adding an extra step: why the users would not go directly into a DeFi platform ?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal could be implemented as the CeFi platform is already active with a fair amount of users, and the proposers seems to have the right skill to lead the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is clear and concise. However, it lacks of some details regarding how the revenue model of the CeFi platform with this new liquidity providing system and what's the additional percentage the users would get by using the CeFi. 
There's a small calculation error on the marketing and social media item: total for 6 months would be 12600$

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly defines and makes known what the problem is and offers a great solution. Proposer claims that their platform is already used by 25,700 people and that if the project were realized, it would definitely have an positive impact and a certain value on the Caradano ecosystem. KPIs in the proposal match the ones indicated in the challenge and it's able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: A link has been placed in the proposal that leads us to a well-designed website where we can clearly see the team behind this project. There is transparency of each team member and they have a link to LinkendIn which is great. But the whole team has more experience in corporate terms than in blockchain although they claim that developers from Wiringbits who participated in Prism for IOHK are helping them. It would be good if the that part is also transparent, because this raises doubts whether the project will be realized. It would be good to have more information of relevant skills and experience needed to realize the project. It is not clear how many developers will work on this project and who are the developers also watching Twitter acc it is strange how someone with 25,700 users has only one or no comments on Twitter but of course it should not mean anything in a negative way. It would have been much better to split the requested amount of $ 96,400 into two Catalyst rounds that would have been reasonable. They could ask for half of the amount in Catalyst F7 and half in Catalyst F8. The budget is clearly presented with a precise allocation of funds, how it will be distributed and an additional funds are not required. A more detailed implementable plan is missing. Realistic timetable is on the website with whom the work will be completed, but that time frame exists regardless of this proposal and is an integral part of the roadmap. More detailed dates are lacking for this project. There are details of actionable tasks and orders of execution, but if they were even deeper and clearer, that would be the right thing. Plan doesn't describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal. This proposal can hardly clearly explain technical aspects such as architecture, language and technologies, because as far as it is visible, there is no experience for such things. There is a risk department within the team, but the proposal does not mention possible risks or offer solutions if risks arise.
f6_assessments.q2: As I have already written, there is a roadmap that is related to an existing project, but not to this proposal. It is not clear how the community can track the success of this project especially when it comes to such large amounts and large time intervals. The KPIs are not clearly set out and can in no way make a link between the KPIs must have and the KPIs presented in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is challenging and impactful, the project has a product and is running on ETH, will switch to Cardano when there is an ERC-20. The project benefits lenders and attracts the flow of money on ETH to Cardano. There is something that I am not clear when I read the whitepaper to want to participate need KYC, this is different from the description as a decentralized system
f6_assessments.q1: I understand the Whitepaper on the website https://www.swanfinance.io/ is the document of the proposal. I have not found information on how to earn interest when staking (16%-20% for swan / 8%-12% for BTC, ETH) and when switching to Cardano, how will it be calculated, just staking ada Can I make a profit in the pool? Funding amount is large $ 96,400 need to describe in detail, the amount of $48000 is not clear how many people and how much time to work for each person,
f6_assessments.q2: A detailed 6-month smart contract development roadmap should be added into smaller, clearer steps with KPIs to be achieved for each of these small steps. Marketing and communication, how is the content performed in 6 months, what are the indicators to achieve. The expanded timeline on the whitepaper outlines key milestones as well as deliverables to be achieved. Should add challenges and risks with other platforms already encountered

f6_assessments.q0: Indifferent is how this proposal hits. Initial thoughts in the beginning painted a picture of calculated incentives that would be part of what would attract CeFi users to this platform but it's still vague on how this can happen.
f6_assessments.q1: It's difficult to acertain that this project will reach it's fruition. One of my concerns is that there are projects on the Cardano blockchain that are already building this. Competition is healthy but it would be great if what is brought can offer something different. It's that difference that's vague at the moment.
f6_assessments.q2: No. Unfortunately. The information provided isn't well fleshed out. We only have number of users currently using the platform. We don't have the number of monthly active users and that's very important. An increase in active users would be a great measuring stick.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal will offer a tool to bridge more liquidity and assets onto the Cardano chain, and those assets would be utilized in Cardano defi projects.
f6_assessments.q1: Even if implemented, it's duplicative to several other endeavors at a signifiant enough price for the community treasury. Instead of focusing on ERC-20 convertors as others are, perhaps assets of other chains (that aren't being actively considered) could be considered.
f6_assessments.q2: Author hasn't defined what success looks like (e.g., X amount of assets or liquidity transferred from CeFi via convertor). However, this information should be accessible via blockchain metadata.

solution: Os usuários poderão usar seus depósitos criptográficos na plataforma CeFi para ganhar juros adicionais através de contratos inteligentes Plutus na DeFi.
experience: John Ro serviu em 2 startups de cadeia de blocos: Relex e Paysic. Os desenvolvedores da Wiringbits que participaram do Prism para a IOHK estão nos ajudando.
